meanings.definition: Resembling a toad in appearance or behavior.
meanings.sent1: The bumpy skin of the toadish creature blended perfectly with the muddy ground.
meanings.sent2: The toadish figure hopped slowly across the garden, searching for insects.
meanings.sent3: The toadish prince croaked a love song to the princess, much to her amusement.
meanings.sent4: Her toadish features seemed to come alive under the moonlight, casting a mysterious aura.
meanings.sent5: The toadish costume was so realistic that it startled the children at the costume party.

meanings.definition: Having qualities or characteristics associated with a toad.
meanings.sent1: The pond was filled with toadish creatures croaking in the evening.
meanings.sent2: His toadish behavior of sitting still for hours reminded everyone of a patient toad.
meanings.sent3: The toadish sense of humor made him the life of the party, always ready with a joke.
meanings.sent4: Her toadish stubbornness showed when she refused to move from her comfortable spot.
meanings.sent5: The toadish charm of the old garden drew visitors in with its quaint beauty.
